item.title: How could the blockchain affect democracy?
item.description:
How could the blockchain affect democracy?

Answer (1 of 2): In terms of democratic elections, Blockchain based voting is the ultimate way to prove the following: 1.) As a citizen, to check that your ballot was officially counted 2.) Prevent lost ballots, and ensure a permanent way to review results of past elections. Also, it's a great...

item.title: Is there any open source solution for blockchain?
item.description:
Is there any open source solution for blockchain?

Answer (1 of 3): Yes, every blockchain solution is open source. Thats the entire purpose of the technology - to be open, easily accessible, auditable, and have the security/code reviewed by anyone. If however by blockchain you meant private block chains, then I'm not sure. I do know that mijin i...

item.title: Is there any books for dummies to learn about blockchain and ethereum?
item.description:
Is there any books for dummies to learn about blockchain and ethereum?

Answer: I would suggest The Business Blockchain. The book gives a thorough overview of blockchain, the technologies influenced by blockchain, and describes it as a disruptive technology like the internet in the 90â€²s. Though the book does not detail "ethereum", it gives source to reader where to f...

item.title: Where do I go if I want to create a new blockchain?
item.description:
Where do I go if I want to create a new blockchain?

Answer (1 of 3): In short: * Yes, you can "create" a new instance of Blockchain on your PC. * No, I guess most blockchains can be developed also on Linux/Windows machines. * That depends on what you want to do. If you just want to run a clone of existing blockchain like Bitcoin - you would o...

item.title: What are the implications of blockchain technology in payment processing industry?
item.description:
What are the implications of blockchain technology in payment processing industry?

Answer: As Visa Europe was quoted saying: The Blockchain is 'No Longer a Choice': Article: Visa Europe: The Blockchain is 'No Longer a Choice' Visa is already piloting using Bitcoin for internal remittances and settling of funds, which shows us that the transition to Bitcoin/Blockchain is alre...

item.title: How has gambling become more fair with blockchain?
item.description:
How has gambling become more fair with blockchain?

Answer (1 of 2): I agree with John - blockchain hasn't yet made gambling fair. However, there is potential to make it fair. The way that happens is by putting a software middleman in place. Let us imagine a gamble on the outcome of a soccer match for $100.

item.title: What is your opinion about Bitcoin and blockchain technology?
item.description:
What is your opinion about Bitcoin and blockchain technology?

Answer: In many ways, that is two questions. Bitcoin is a payment system. Blockchain is a software technique for managing virtual ledgers that is implemented through the use of multiple computers. Bitcoin uses the blockchain as the foundation of how it works. Bitcoin may or may not be around ...

item.title: Ethereum Price Analysis - Further Appreciation or Depreciation?
item.description:
Ethereum Price Analysis - Further Appreciation or Depreciation?

Ethereum price moved below the 100 SMA, but stayed above a support trend line. Can it recover or break the support to move down? Ethereum price moved below the 100 SMA, but stayed above a support trend line. Can it recover or break the support to move down?

item.title: The Crypto Show on the Arcade City experiment and yes it's working.
item.description:
The Crypto Show on the Arcade City experiment and yes it's working.

We focus the whole show on the arrival of Arcade City to Austin. Whether the App works or not on the Ethereum platform is irrelevant because the guerrilla marketing taking place on the interim Facebook page is amazing.

item.title: Centralized Monetary Systems Need To Be Replaced
item.description:
Centralized Monetary Systems Need To Be Replaced

There has been a lot of discussion as to why the banking ecosystem needs to change, rather than to stick to its centralised model. Then again, there are so many negative aspects associated with the money we use today; it becomes only more obvious centralised systems are on their way out.
